page.title: 01Around Cockley Cley,Norfolk
page.content: The area in general slopes from approx 145 ft high in east to approximatey 60 ft in west. Apart from meadowland alongside the stream, the soil is light and sandy. Large fields predominate with belts of mature scots pine as windbreaks. Extensive conifer plantations lie to north and west of village which is situated on the steep northern slope of this small valley. The population is about 140, of which some 30 children attend school in Swaffham 3 1/2 miles distant. There is a church,a public house (twenty churchwardens) the only shop with post office closed recently. The hamlet of Shingham, some half dozen dwellings and farm, is about 4 miles to north west.
